appendix1.header: Severe Acute Respiratory Infection (SARI) Case Report Form
appendix1.probableCaseNote: Novel Coronaviruses (including COVID-19) are listed as Diseases of Public Health Significance under the Health Protection and Promotion Act. Clinicians must report probable cases (as per current case definition) and individuals who are being tested for COVID-19 to the Grey Bruce Health Unit.
appendix1.coughLabel: Cough (or exacerbation of a chronic cough)
appendix1.travelOusideCanadaLabel: Travel outside of Canada in last 14 days prior to onset of illness
appendix1.closeContactWithProbableCaseLabel: Close contact with a lab-confirmed or probable case of COVID-19 in the 14 days before symptom onset?
appendix1.closeContactWithARILabel: Close contact with a person with acute respiratory illness who travelled outside of Canada within 14 days prior to onset of illness?
appendix1.dateOfReturnOfContactLabel: Date of return of contact (if travelled)
appendix1.dateOfOnsetSymptomsOfContactLabel: Date of symptom onset of contact
appendix1.patientMeetsProbableCaseLabel: Does the patient meet probable case definition?
appendix1.patientWorkInHealthcareLabel: Does the patient work in a health care setting?
appendix1.testingConductedLabel: Was testing conducted for this patient?
patientAdvise: Please advise patient to self-isolate for 14 days from onset of symptoms
Please advise patient to notify household and close contacts* to self-isolate for 14 days from last contact
closeContact: A person who provided care for the patient, including healthcare workers not wearing appropriate PPE, family members, or other care givers
A person who had other similar close physical contact
A person who lived with or otherwise had close, prolonged contact with probable or confirmed case while case was ill
appendix1.selfIsolateLabel: Please advise patient to self-isolate until results are returned. Turnaround time is up to 6 days.
appendix1.completionLabel: SARI Form completed successfully. Please return back to start a new evaluation.
